answers.answer: Hello,One of the possibilities for such burning sensations is hormonal changes which occur at this age i.e. because of menopause. The other possibilities are parasathesia because of abnormal functioning of neurons. It can also occur due to diabetes, peripheral vascular disease, vita min B 12 deficiency, thyroid disease or malnutrition. I suggest you to consult a gynaecologist for your mother and get her started on hormonal replacement therapy.I hope it helps. Take care and regards.

question: My mother has been suffering for a while with itching and burning of the skin.  It happens every few months and she has been to several GPs who have been unable to come up with an answer.  She has been through all the regular questions relating to her symptoms, like allergies, washing powder, toiletries, diet, etc.  GPs have suggested stress or menopause but only last night she spoke to her brother and he recalled her having the same symptoms when she was around 5 or 6, for around 4 years.  I feel so bad for her as she cant sleep at night - she has the problem during the day but night time is worse.  She is 58.  Thanks for any help!!!
title: Itching and Burning Skin
